alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 2:40AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .Heavy rainfall along and either side of the Blue Ridge near the Floyd...Franklin county border. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and west central Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Floyd. In west central Virginia, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 630 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 237 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen across this region during the past several hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hatchet Creek, Little Chestnut Creek, Lick Fork, Grassy Fork, Coles Creek, Boothe Creek, Dodd Creek, Little Creek, Blackwater River, Big Chestnut Creek and Beaverdam Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Floyd... Ferrum... Copper Hill... Callaway... Endicott... Check... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
